alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:37PM EST until January 10 at 1:47PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maryland... Seneca Creek at Dawsonville affecting Montgomery County. For the Seneca Creek...including Dawsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Seneca Creek at Dawsonville. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Portions of the Seneca Creek Greenway are flooded. A small portion of Berryville Road west of Darnestown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:50 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.2 feet, or 3.3 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 7.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 03/04/1993. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1AM 7AM 1PM Stg Time Date Seneca Creek Dawsonville 7.5 4.2 Tue 4 pm 7.5 7.8 5.5 7.8 7am Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 545 AM EST.
